org.opends.server.replication.server

Class DataServerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.api.MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
      • org.opends.server.replication.server.MessageHandler
        • org.opends.server.replication.server.ServerHandler
          • org.opends.server.replication.server.DataServerHandler

  • public class DataServerHandler
extends ServerHandler
    This class defines a server handler, which handles all interaction with a peer server (RS or DS).

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataServerHandler

        public DataServerHandler(Session session,
                 int queueSize,
                 java.lang.String replicationServerURL,
                 int replicationServerId,
                 ReplicationServer replicationServer,
                 int rcvWindowSize)
        Creates a new data server handler.
        Parameters:
        session - The session opened with the remote data server.
        queueSize - The queue size.
        replicationServerURL - The URL of the hosting RS.
        replicationServerId - The serverID of the hosting RS.
        replicationServer - The hosting RS.
        rcvWindowSize - The receiving window size.

    • Method Detail

      • changeStatusForResetGenId

        public void changeStatusForResetGenId(long newGenId)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Order the peer DS server to change his status or close the connection according to the requested new generation id.
        Parameters:
        newGenId - The new generation id to take into account
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If IO error occurred.

      • changeStatusFromStatusAnalyzer

        public ServerStatus changeStatusFromStatusAnalyzer(StatusMachineEvent event)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Change the status according to the event generated from the status analyzer.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to be used for new status computation
        Returns:
        The new status of the DS
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When raised by the underlying session

        public boolean processStartFromRemote(ServerStartMsg serverStartMsg)
                               throws DirectoryException
        Processes a start message received from a remote data server.
        Parameters:
        serverStartMsg - The provided start message received.
        Returns:
        flag specifying whether the remote server requests encryption.
        Throws:
        DirectoryException - raised when an error occurs.
